BBEX3.A.LTL.EUR.CA.AC.A04: Exchange rates for the euro in Lithuania / EUR 1 = LTL ... (middle) / up to 2014

General: Until 1 February 2002, the litas was pegged to the US dollar (USD 1 = LTL 4.00) and from 2 February 2002 to 31 December 2014, it was pegged to the euro. Lithuania joined the euro area on 1 January 2015; irrevocable euro conversion rate: EUR 1 = LTL 3.45280.
Source: The Bank of Lithuania, Vilnius.
Methodology: Until 2002, calculated on the basis of mid-month and month-end rates.
Comment on 2002: On 2 February 2002, the litas ceased to be pegged to the US dollar (USD 1 = LTL 4.00) and was pegged to the euro instead at a rate of EUR 1 = LTL 3.4528.
